main_definition: Expectations are the beliefs or notions about what is likely to happen in the future, or desires regarding how someone should behave or perform.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Anticipation of a certain level of performance or behavior
meanings_and_examples.example: The teacher has high expectations for all her students to excel academically.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A set of standards or benchmarks one hopes will be met by someone or something
meanings_and_examples.example: Her parents have certain expectations about the kind of career she should pursue.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The desire for a specific outcome to occur in the future
meanings_and_examples.example: His expectations are that his friends will show up on time for their weekly meet-up.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Unpleasant or disappointing outcomes when reality does not match one's hopes or wishes
meanings_and_examples.example: He was disheartened by the fact that his expectations of receiving a promotion were not met this year.
